page.title: 16Percy's Local Shop, Draycott
page.content: Draycott's local "corner shop" is known as Percy's. There has been a shop there for about 60 years, with the present owner being in residence for the last 23 years. It was at one time a fish and chip shop. Currently he sells groceries, green groceries, wines and spirits, meat, and confectionary. Most of his customers come from Draycott, Cresswell, Saverly Green, Forsbrook, Fulford , Cheadle and Meir. There is some passing trade. The shop opens in the morning at 8-30 then closes for lunch from 1-00 to 3-00. It closes at 6-00 and reopens at 7-30 until 9-30. Deliveries are made from the shop. The shop itself is only about 12 feet wide by 30 feet deep. The owner lives at the back and over the shop
